Hapkeite.Environment: The new mineral is interpreted to have formed by impact-induced, vapor-phase deposition in lunar soil.
Hapkeite.Locality: Occurs in a regolith-breccia clast in the lunar meteorite Dhofar 280 from Oman. Link to MinDat.org Location Data.
Hapkeite.Name Origin: Named for Bruce Hapke (emeritus, University of Pittsburgh). who first predicted the presence of vapor-deposited elemental Fe as coatings on lunar soil grains.

Hapkeite

Location: Dhofar 280 (Dh-280) is a lunar fragmental breccia meteorite found in the Dhofar region of Oman, in April, 2001. Scale: See Image.
